title: House votes to censure Democratic Rep. Adam Schiff
description: The California Democrat, who gained national recognition during his participation in congressional investigations of former President Trump, is a frequent target of Republicans and Trump himself.

title: Pentagon leak suspect Jack Teixeira pleads not guilty to federal charges
description: If convicted of the six charges against him, the 21-year-old Air National guardsman could face up to 10 years in prison for each charge.

title: Trump-era special counsel defends his report on Russia probe against Democrats' jabs
description: Former special counsel John Durham issued a report last month accusing the FBI of negligence in its Trump-Russia investigation.

title: Blinken visited China. Then Biden called Xi a dictator. So what comes next?
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken's recent visit to China was considered a success by government officials. In such a complicated relationship, what does that even look like?

title: Peru is reeling from record case counts of dengue fever. What's driving the outbreak?
description: The number of patients is soaring, the health system is stressed and the government is facing criticism over its response. So far 150,000 Peruvians have caught the virus this year and 248 have died.

title: Jan. 6 rioter who used a stun gun on Officer Michael Fanone sentenced to prison
description: Daniel Joseph "DJ" Rodriguez, 40, of Fontana, Calif., was sentenced to 12.5 years. Officer Fanone served on the Metropolitan Police Department Officer for nearly two decades before resigning in 2021.

title: Paris police look for the cause of an explosion and fire that injured 24 people
description: The explosion rocked a building, igniting a fire that sent smoke soaring over monuments and prompting an evacuation. Police were investigating suspicions that a gas leak caused the blast.

title: Four immigrants who sought sanctuary in churches no longer face deportation
description: Under the settlement with immigration authorities, the four women can apply for asylum. They also no longer face thousands in fines imposed by the former Trump administration.

title: 'Excessive' weather events mark summer solstice in the U.S.
description: The longest day of the year comes as the Southern U.S. endures record heat. Other regions are seeing persistent heavy rains, raising flood risks.

title: A frontline city in Yemen is desperate for change after nearly a decade of civil war
description: Nearly a decade of civil war has destroyed millions of Yemeni lives, but perhaps nowhere has it been felt more than in the neighborhoods in Taiz that are closest to the fighting.

title: Monarch butterflies' white spots may help them fly farther, scientists say
description: Monarch butterflies with more white spots on their mostly orange-and-black wings are more successful at long-distance migration. Some scientists think the spots may affect airflow around their wings.

title: U.S. reading and math scores drop to lowest level in decades
description: Newly released data from national test scores in reading and math show a worrisome picture of student learning loss since the pandemic.

title: 'No kill' meat, grown from animal cells, is now approved for sale in the U.S.
description: Two U.S. food companies  have received the go-ahead to sell chicken grown from cultivated animal cells in a production facility. It's the first time meat grown this way will be sold in the U.S.

title: FTC sues Amazon for 'tricking and trapping' people in Prime subscriptions
description: Federal regulators say Amazon uses manipulative techniques to enroll shoppers into Prime memberships that are purposefully hard to cancel.

title: Justice Alito refutes ProPublica report that he took a luxury trip with billionaire
description: Justice Samuel Alito says he didn't have to disclose a 2008 luxury trip to Alaska, or the flight on a private jet of hedge fund billionaire Paul Singer who had several cases before the high court.

title: This WWII battle wasn't against Nazis. It was between Black and white GIs in England
description: It's the 80th anniversary of a little-known battle — by Black U.S. soldiers against segregation in the military. They were convicted of mutiny. Villagers in England want them exonerated.

title: Germany's Green Party wants people to use heat pumps to save energy. Some are balking
description: Some German homeowners are worried they'll have to foot the bill for their country's climate targets by replacing their gas boilers with cleaner — but more expensive — heat pumps.

title: A year after Yellowstone floods, fishing guides have to learn 'a whole new river'
description: A year ago the Yellowstone River had its biggest flood in centuries. What that means for its world famous trout fishery is just now becoming clear.

title: 'Rich White Men' reinforces the argument that inequality harms us all
description: While not a new concept, Garrett Neiman makes distinct contributions to the conversation; as a rich white man, he has insider's access to that population — and doesn't shy away from self-indictment.

title: A Mississippi teen unpacks how the Jackson water crisis impacts education
description: 17-year-old Georgianna McKenny is the high school grand prize winner in NPR's fifth annual Student Podcast Challenge.

title: The Academy of American Poets names its first Latino head
description: Ricardo Alberto Maldonado will become the almost-90-year-old academy's executive director and president.

title: Rescue teams continue search for missing passengers in submersible
description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with WBUR's Walter Wuthmann about updates in the search for missing Titan submersible.

title: Missing submersible: Rescuers race to find Titan after detecting underwater noises
description: The U.S. Coast Guard said that a surveillance plane detected "underwater noises" close to where the Titan lost contact with its control room. Experts say the sub's oxygen may run out on Thursday.

title: In 'The Fight for Midnight,' a teen boy confronts the abortion debate
description: Dan Solomon's YA novel The Fight for Midnight takes place during former Texas state lawmaker Wendy Davis' filibuster of a bill that would restrict access to abortion. The protagonist is a teen boy.

title: Experts raised concerns about potential problems with submersibles and their tours
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Will Kohnen, chairman of the Marine Technology Society's Submarine Group, about concerns that were raised about the development of the now-missing Titan submersible.

title: Up First: Titan submersible search; abortion poll; anxiety screenings
description: Crews detected "underwater noises" this morning while searching for the Titan. A majority of Americans oppose the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe. And, why you should be screened for anxiety.

title: Student podcasters share the dark realities of middle school in America
description: School shootings, social media, beauty standards. 13-year-olds Erika Young and Norah Weiner delve into what middle school looks like today in their award-winning podcast.

title: Their prize catch was set to bring in $3.5 million. Then the fish was disqualified
description: The boat's crew isn't accused of any wrongdong. Their catch in the Big Rock Blue Marlin Tournament in North Carolina was disqualified because it was mutilated — bitten by a shark or another animal.

title: How many miles do you have to travel to get abortion care? One professor maps it
description: An economics professor at Middlebury College and her undergrad research assistants have been tracking access to abortion care since 2009. These maps show the dramatic changes in the past decade.

title: Election workers are facing threats and harassment as they brace for 2024
description: Election workers across 22 different states told NPR they've received threats or felt unsafe doing their jobs, and many are worried for what the 2024 presidential election will bring.

title: OceanGate wants to change deep-sea tourism, but its missing sub highlights the risks
description: OceanGate's expeditions to the Titanic were meant to herald a new era for deep-sea tourism, but the company's missing submersible has instead underscored the danger these journeys can bring.

title: A dying patient inspired this doctor to change careers
description: Physician Abraham Verghese reflects on a defining moment in 1985, when one of his terminally ill patients reminded him to follow his dreams.

title: A dying patient inspired this doctor to follow his dream to become a writer
description: Physician Abraham Verghese reflects on a defining moment in 1985, when one of his terminally ill patients reminded him to follow his dreams.

title: Trump's advantages are huge in the 2024 GOP primary right now
description: President Biden meanwhile has seen his approval rating stabilize and is well liked among Democrats, though he faces challenges with independents and younger voters.

title: Church of England clergy asks for a pay raise for the first time in history
description: The United Kingdom has been struggling with a cost-of-living crisis since 2021. Clergy members are asking for a 9.5% pay hike that would begin in April 2024.

title: Majority of Americans say it was wrong for the Supreme Court to overturn Roe
description: A year after the court did away with the right to an abortion, 57% say they oppose the decision, an NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll finds. They're also in favor of continuing affirmative action programs.

title: Greek court orders smuggling suspects held pending trial over migrant ship disaster
description: The Egyptian suspects face charges that include participation in a criminal organization, manslaughter and causing a shipwreck.

title: Search intensifies for the missing submersible as underwater noises are detected
description: Rescue teams seeking the submersible housing five tourists that had planned to visit the wrecked Titanic said "noises" had been detected close to where the sub ended contact with its mother ship.

title: Summer solstice brings druids, pagans and thousands of curious people to Stonehenge
description: A seemingly curious alliance of druids, pagans, hippies, local residents and tourists gathered around Stonehenge and greeted sunrise on Wednesday, which is the longest day in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Dozens of women die in a grisly riot in Honduran prison the president blames on gangs
description: Twenty-six of the 41 known victims were burned to death and the remainder shot or stabbed at the prison in Tamara, about 30 miles northwest of the Honduran capital of Tegucigalpa, police said.
